page.title: 17HAILES WOOD 3 ECOLOGY
page.content: DAMP WOODLAND Springs flow from the junction between impervious lower lias clay and the base of the limestone,giving rise to damp woodland on the lower slopes. Rushes,tufted hair grass and pendulous sedge are found in the wetter areas.Wych elm is abundant here and the{white-letter hairstreak}can be found feeding on bramble & privet nectar in July.The {high brown {fritillary}also frequents the same area.The early flowering guelder rose provides nectar for the local beetle { {Ischnomera caerulea.}In the rides the red and black leaf hopper{Cercopis {vulnerata}is common. In autumn the delicate pink flowers of{meadow {saffron}can be seen here. (continued)
